abstract.text: Creates a new signer.
The last version of the transaction containing all signatures generated by this signer.
An affordance to sign multiple inputs of a bitcoin transaction.
Mnemonic phrase needs to contain a valid number of words.
Witness version 0 Bitcoin address.
Signs a multi-signature input.
Turns a private key into a public key removing its ability to produce signatures.
The current signature hash type.
Mnemonic contains an invalid word.
A common interface for all types of Bitcoin addresses: legacy, segwit and taproot. An address can be decoded from a string and must be able to produce a transaction output for a given satoshi amount.
Checksum calculated for nmemonic phrase does not match.

Generate and decode Bitcoin addresses. Manage mnemonic seeds and derive Hierarchically Deterministic (HD) keys.
Generates an output for use in transactions.
Mnemonic word list language not supported.
Decodes a string representation of an address into a Bitcoin address instance.
Derives either a child private key from a parent private key, or a child public key form a parent public key.
Legacy – i.e. base signature version – Bitcoin address.
A BIP32 extended key whether it be a private master key, extended private key or an extended public key.
Witness version 1 or higher Bitcoin address.
Signs a single key input.
BIP39
Creates a BIP39 mnemonic phrase. The generated sequence of words, each separated by a space character.
Type-erased bitcoin address. Use when needing to decode and generate outputs but the type of address being decoded is not known beforehand
